revisions.rev:
{{Infobox software | name = OpenOffice.org Impress | logo = [[File:OOoImpress321logo.png|52px]] | screenshot = [[File:OpenOffice.org Impress.png|300px]] | caption = OpenOffice.org Impress 3 | collapsible = | developer = [[Sun Microsystems]] | status = Active | latest release version = 3.3 | latest release date = {{Release date and age|2011|01|25}} | operating system = [[Cross-platform]] | genre = [[Presentation program|Presentation]] | license = [[GNU Lesser General Public License]] | website = [http://www.openoffice.org/product/impress.html www.openoffice.org] }} '''OpenOffice.org Impress''', a part of the [[OpenOffice.org]] [[office suite]] and developed by [[Sun Microsystems]], is an [[open source]] [[presentation program]] compatible with and similar to [[Microsoft PowerPoint]].<ref>[http://www.sun.com/software/star/openoffice/ OpenOffice.org<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref name = "NewsForge">[http://www.linux.com/articles/40736 Linux.com :: Microsoft PowerPoint versus OpenOffice.org Impress<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> In addition to being able to create PDF files from presentations, it is also able to export presentations to [[SWF]] files allowing them to be played on any computer with a [[Flash player]] installed. It is able to view, edit and save files in several file formats, including the .ppt format, which is used by [[Microsoft PowerPoint]].<ref>[http://www.openoffice.org/product/impress.html Impress<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
OpenOffice.org Impress users can install the [[Open Clip Art Library]], which adds a large gallery of images for general presentation and drawing projects. [[Linux distribution]]s [[Debian]], [[Gentoo Linux|Gentoo]], [[Mandriva]] and [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] have provided the ready-to-use ''openclipart'' package for download and install from their online software repositories.
Released under the terms of the [[GNU Lesser General Public Licence]], Impress is [[free software]].
== See also == {{Portal|Free software}}
* [[Open Clip Art Library]] * [[Comparison of office suites]]

=== Templates and resources === * [http://documentation.openoffice.org/Samples_Templates/User/template/presentations/index.html Presentation Templates] from the [http://documentation.openoffice.org/ official documentation page] * [http://technology.chtsai.org/impress/ OpenOffice.org Impress Templates] * [http://extensions.services.openoffice.org/ Extension Repository for OpenOffice]
=== Guide and Articles === * [http://documentation.openoffice.org/manuals/ OpenOffice.org 2.x Impress Guide] * [http://documentation.openoffice.org/HOW_TO/impress/fs_impress2_0.pdf First Steps in Impress], updated for OpenOffice.org 2.0 * [http://wiki.services.openoffice.org/wiki/Documentation/OOoAuthors_User_Manual/Migration_Guide/Impress_and_PowerPoint Differences In Use Between Impress and Powerpoint] * [http://www.tuxmagazine.com/node/1000178 TuxMagazine issue 10] (free PDF download after registration) ** ''OpenOffice.org 2.0 Impress: the Confusing Duckling Becomes a User-Friendly Swan'' by ''[http://openoffice.blogs.com/ Solveig L. Haugland]'' * [http://www.linuxjournal.com/article/7187 Delivering Effective Presentations with OpenOffice.org's Impress] * [http://www.linux.com/feature/119513 Linux.com "OpenOffice.org Impress vs. Microsoft PowerPoint, round 2" (2007)] * [http://www.linux.com/feature/148435 "Impress has finally achieved total parity in features with PowerPoint" (OpenOffice.org 3.0)]
